alert.note: Alert for Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 21 at 7:39PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...The Buckland River downstream of Buckland, just beyond the end of the runway. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...An official in Buckland reports an ice jam has formed downstream of the village just beyond the end of the runway and extending downriver past the location of last year`s ice jam. The river has risen 8 ft during the day and is only 4 ft from bankfull. Local reports and satellite imagery show there is still lots of ice upstream that hasn`t moved down river yet. If the jam does not break, village officials believe the river may overtop its banks and begin flooding the village Saturday night or Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An ice jam may cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Residents of Buckland should monitor conditions and take precautions to protect life and property.
